text: So it wasn't he he was uh Second round pick for the um Packers back in the 2000 draft, same as Brady. Took over starting left tackle position um halfway through his rookie season. Um Giffin's 2002 season seemed as promising as his first two. However, on November 24th, he suffered a severe pelvic injury after receiving a blindside hit from the Tampa Bay Bucks defensive tackle Warren Sapp. Because the incident occurred after an interception with Clifton far from the play, Sapp received harsh criticism for his action. After the game, when Packers head coach Mike Sherman told Sapp that his play was uncalled for, Sapp began angrily shouting at Sherman in attire that was caught on camera with Sapp famously screaming, put a jersey on. For his part, Sapp did not visit or telephone Clifton during his four-day stay in a Tampa Bay hospital. As a result of his injury, Clifton missed the rest of the season, was hospitalized for almost a week, and could not walk unaided for five more weeks. In 2005, the NFL Competition Committee agreed on new guidelines for unnecessary roughness, making hits such as that suffered by Clifton illegal.
